intro: Platostoma palustre, commonly known as the marsh stinkcup, is a perennial herbaceous plant belonging to the family Pterobryaceae. It is characterized by its small, greenish-yellow to reddish-brown, cup-like spore-bearing structures called peridia. The plant typically grows in moist, acidic soils in wetlands, bogs, and other damp habitats. It has a creeping growth habit with rhizomes and can form dense mats. Platostoma palustre is often found in temperate regions of the Northern Hemisphere.
